definition[1]: someone whose job is to represent an organization and answer questions about it, especially when something bad has happened
example[0]: They spent millions on lobbyists and flacks to improve their image.
definition[2]: a person whose job is to represent an organization and talk to newspaper and television reporters, answering their questions about a negative story involving the organization
example[1]: He put a shield between himself and the press by hiring a flack to handle media calls.
